Quests.Name: Spelunking
Quests.Start Dialogue:
You there, are you okay? (PLAYERNAME) is it? You must have been dropped off here not long ago. Here, take these.
<color=grey>(Akk-Lune hands you multiple items)</color>
I represent The <color=yellow>Ensis</color>, a group of individuals dedicated to creating a thriving civilization on Axu. I can help you get an audience with our leader if you wish. There is a cave in this building here. At the bottom lays an item we need. Grab it for me, and I may be able to help you. We could use a person of skill.
Quests.Description: Explore the underground caverns. There are stairs down inside the <color=yellow>building</color> you started in front of.

Events.Console Command: give cloak1|give flask/liquid_regenitrol|log You were given a few items by Akk-Lune.

Quests.Name: Spelunking II
Quests.Description: Find further passages down to make your way to the <color=yellow>bottom</color> of this cave. The artifact must be there.

Quests.Name: The Hunter's Artifact
Quests.Description: You sense a powerful hostile presence nearby. <color=yellow>Defeat the menace, then talk to Akk-Lune</color> and give him the artifact it holds.
Quests.End Dialogue:
That took longer than expected! Did you encounter difficulties? A <color=red>Deep Hunter</color>? Here? My appologies for putting you in danger.
The item you retrieved for me is a special keycard, used to activate the terminals in the Power Plant. It was stolen from us not long ago, and has made communications a pain, as you can imagine. I need you to <color=cyan>turn the power on</color>. There are five sub-terranean levels, each with a <color=yellow>terminal</color>. Turn all of them on to give back power. I would go myself, but I have matters to attend to. You'll hear from us when you've completed this task.

Quests.Name: Find the Power Plant
Quests.Description: Find the abandoned Power Plant.
Quests.End Dialogue: I've found the Power Plant that Akk-Lune was talking about. I need to enter and turn on all five terminals below.

Quests.Name: Deactivate the Terminals
Quests.Description: Turn on the five terminals inside the Power Plant. There is one on each floor.
Quests.End Dialogue:
You hear machines hum beneath you. The plant has come back to life. A crackle can be heard, and suddenly a voice from speakers above says:
<color=lightblue>"(PLAYERNAME), my friend. I thank you for getting the power plant back online. My name is Arthomas, and I have heard your deeds from Akk-Lune. Come see me. We can work something mutually beneficial."</color>

Quests.Name: Find the Ensis
Quests.Description: A voice told you to find people known as <color=yellow>"The Ensis"</color>. Arthomas is waiting for you at their stronghold.
Quests.End Dialogue: A pleasure to meet you! My name is Arthomas. Please head inside. <color=yellow>Lomis</color> is waiting to speak with you. You've been granted permission to enter the facility. Don't cause trouble, now...

Quests.Name: Speak with Lomis
Quests.Description: Arthomas told you to <color=yellow>meet</color> Lomis, head of the Ensis. He will answer any questions you may have.
Quests.End Dialogue: Thank you for coming. My name is Lomis, and this is my city. I am the leader of the Ensis. You must be (PLAYERNAME). Listen, I think we can make a deal. You do some work for us, and I can get you a ship. You do want to go home right? Good. Now, I need you to destroy a statue. There is a cult called the <color=red>Kin of the Deep</color>, and they have been growing in numbers. Their statues are connected to their dieties, whatever they may be. Destroying one will grant us some time. Take this <color=yellow>pickaxe</color>. Hopefully it will be strong enough to smash it.

Quests.Name: A Message
Quests.Description: <color=yellow>Destroy a Statue</color>. They can be found in the <color=red>Kindred Hideout</color>. A digging tool has been provided.
Quests.End Dialogue: It is good to see you alive and well. We've begun construction on your ship. I've granted you access to the <color=cyan>lower levels of the facility</color>. Beneath the <color=yellow>Prison</color> is the <color=yellow>Workshop</color>. Head there if you wish to check on its progress. You will meet our head engineer, Ka-Nil. Be wary, he is a very peculiar individual.

Quests.Name: Heart Recovery
Quests.Description: Recover an <color=yellow>Irradiated Heart</color> for Ka-Nil's experiments. The creature at the bottom level of the Stronghold has one.
Quests.Start Dialogue: Ah yes, good day to you. Lomis told me to expect you. I'm the head Ensistic engineer and scientist. It was quite a surprise to hear I'd be building a ship. It certainly will take a while. In the meantime, could you help me with a bit of research? I need an <color=yellow>Irradiated Heart</color>. Don't you mind what it's for. I've managed to capture a specimen. It's <color=yellow>down one level</color>. All I need is for you to kill it, and tear out its heart.
Quests.End Dialogue: Ah yes, thank you. My experiments aren't exactly condoned by Lomis, so I have to keep my collection a secret. If you grab me more items, I can make you healing concoctions. This is great. My very own apprentice! Find me 4 Spiny Fronds and I can do this for you. They can be found on the Man-Eating Plants on the surface. Go now! He he he..

Quests.Name: Apprenticeship
Quests.Description: Ka-Nil needs you to find 4 <color=yellow>Spiny Fronds</color>
Quests.End Dialogue: You found the fronds I desired? Here you go, apprentice. <color=cyan>Lomis called for you.</color>. I wouldn't keep him waiting.

Quests.Name: What Lies Beneath
Quests.Description: Explore beneath the Kin of the Deep hideout.
Quests.Start Dialogue: You're back. I tust you found Ka-Nil? He's an eccentric one, but utterly reliable. Your ship will be done in time. There is one thing I must ask of you, even if I don't wish to involve more people than I already have. The Kin of the Deep are conducting some kind of experiments beneath their base. I need to know what these are. Get as far as you can below, and return to me.
Quests.End Dialogue: Living statues? Altars? I fear we have no time to lose. The Kindred wish to summon the <color=yellow>Deep Ones</color>, their dieties, here as physical entities. If this were to happen, I can't say the Ensis would survive. They wish to destroy every ounce of our past. Starting with our libraries, our archives, and even keepsakes held by mourning family members. These statues must be their initial experiments with transfering living essence ito physical bodies. I must ask you to visit their <color=yellow>Cathedral</color>, and see if you can gather information.

Quests.Name: The Cathedral
Quests.Description: Find answers in the Kindred's Cathedral.
Quests.End Dialogue: Ensis? Here? Or simply a freelancer? How strange. Have you come to murder me and my kin? Perhaps you wish to view the situation from a less narrow-minded view? Forgive me, my name is Corith. I am the high priest of this cathedral, devoted to the <color=cyan>Deep Ones</color> I can tell you're new here, and the conflict goes a bit beyond your understanding. Do not fret, I understand your desire to return home. That's what they promised you, yes? If you hear out our side, I will tell you everything you wish to know. Talk to me again when you are ready.

Quests.Name: Information
Quests.Description: Talk to Corith to gain information on The Kin of the Deep.
Quests.End Dialogue:
Let me ask you one thing: How are we to forge ahead while looking over our shoulder, drilling the mistakes of others into our skull? Our founder, <color=cyan>Isazna</color> spoke to ancient dieties presiding over this planet, and was offered the chance to make a new start. Not only surviving as we do now, we will thrive with the aid of <color=yellow>The Deep Ones</color>, our gods. Their influence is great, but not as powerful as it will become. Soon the first Deep One, Xzol will be transferred into a physical body. The rest will follow. The ritual may begin soon. 

Now... kill me if you must, and return to your master. Perhaps the facts I've given you will be useful. I do hope you see what right we are doing, however.

Quests.Name: The Return
Quests.Description: Return to Lomis and tell him the information you have gathered about the Kin's plans.
Quests.End Dialogue: If what you heard was correct, we need to destroy Xzol's body before he is brought into this plane. Unfortunately, we don't know where it's being held, nor where the ceremony will be. While I gather some intel, <color=yellow>Ka-Nil might need your help</color>. Something regarding your ship.

Quests.Name: Strike the Earth
Quests.Description: Ka-Nil needs <color=yellow>7x Unknown Ore</color>, found only in the Tundra. The best-known veins are located beneath the <color=yellow>Frostborne Village</color>
Quests.Start Dialogue: Just the person I was looking for! I'm afraid I need a favor. There is a particular kind of ore, found beneath the Frostborne Village, in order to complete the body of your ship. Be wary, these people are vicious, attacking everyone on sight. Their technology is quite advanced, focusing on autonamous machines and cold-resistant gear. I'd send somebody else, but you've proven yourself one of the best at this sort of job. Bring something to dig with.
Quests.End Dialogue: I knew I could count on you. Those Frostborne are something, eh? I envy their skill with artificial intelligence. My library has nothing on the subject, and all my experiments have been nothing to write home about. Perhaps I'll figure it out one day. Anyways, I hear you're going after the Kin! Lomis told me to put the ship on hold until we complete this goal. It seems quite unfair after all you've done for us. <color=yellow>Arthomas was also looking for you.</color> I wouldn't keep him waiting.

Quests.Name: See Arthomas
Quests.Description: Go see Arthomas. Ka-Nil said he was looking for you.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good, you're here. Let me know when you're ready to embark on a task to prove your loyalty. Any involvement with the Kin stops here.

Quests.Name: First Strike
Quests.Description: Kill <color=yellow>5 Kindred</color> to prove your loyalty to The Ensis.
Quests.Start Dialogue: I'm preparing a strike against the Kin, and I want you to be a part of it. First, I need you to show your allegiance. Kill 5 Kindred then return to me. We are going to war, and need to know who our allies are. Any ties you may have to the Kin will die with them. Are you one of us, or one of them?
Quests.End Dialogue:
You are truly one of us. I am glad to call you Ensis, (PLAYERNAME).
Our spies have located where the Kin are manufacturing one of their gods' bodies. There's a <color=yellow>Fabrication Plant</color> up North in the <color=yellow>Tundra</color>. If we are lucky, you can make it there in time to stop the construction.

Quests.Name: Body of a God
Quests.Description: Go to the Kindred Fabrication Plant and stop the construction of a Deep One's physical body.
Quests.End Dialogue: The place seems deserted. Perhaps the construction is being done inside.

Quests.Name: The Fabrication Plant
Quests.Description: Explore deeper into the Fabrication Plant.
Quests.End Dialogue: Not a sound. We are already too late. It would be smart to return to Arthomas and tell him of this misfortune.

Quests.Name: Bearer of Bad News
Quests.Description: Return to Arthomas with the unfortunate news.
Quests.End Dialogue: Gone? Damn... We were too late. That means the Deep One's body has been constructed and may now be waiting on a consciousness transfer. Thankfully, we now know where this is going to take place. Beneath the Cathedral, where you met Corith previously, there is some kind of facility. Go there and stop the Kin before it is too late!

Quests.Name: Confrontation
Quests.Description: Go beneath the Cathedral and confront the Kin of the Deep before Xzol has been transferred into his new body.

Quests.Name: Fetching Tools
Quests.Description: The Xul Blacksmith needs you to fetch a couple hammers for him.
Quests.Start Dialogue: You there! If I could ask a few favours while I tend to my shop. I promise it will be worth your while. I can strengthen your weapon for you if you complete what I need. First, I broke my hammer and could use a couple replacements. Could you grab two for me?
Quests.End Dialogue: You have my thanks. Next, I've been having trouble getting outside customers with all the hostile wildlife about. Kill some <color=yellow>Winged Snappers</color> for me. 5 should do the trick to scare them off. Come back when you're done.

Quests.Name: Damn Snappers
Quests.Description: The Xul Blacksmith needs you to kill <color=yellow>5 Winged Snappers</color> to encourage customers to come South.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good timing! A group of Lepers has come to raid our wares! Please get rid of them for us! I beg you!

Quests.Name: Missing Person II
Quests.Description: Take the missing person back to Har'Kallem.
Quests.End Dialogue: You have my thanks, (PLAYERNAME). Here's some money for your trouble. I'll make my way back to Har'Kallem right away!

Quests.Name: Leper Attack
Quests.Description: Lepers have invaded the Xul Village. Take them out.
Quests.End Dialogue: Thank you so much! It's only fair that I pass on the means to improve a weapon of yours. Take this Xul Mod Kit. Safe travels, wanderer. Oh, before you go, a friend of mine, Saira, is wandering near the Oasis. I'm sure she could use some help if you are willing. She's kept us fed with her hunting for years. I would be very greatful if you could check up on her.

Quests.Name: Saira's Hunt
Quests.Description: Kill 8 Parasects with the help of Saira.
Quests.Start Dialogue: (PLAYERNAME), I presume? I heard from the Blacksmith that you were coming to help me on a few errands. I have to get some meat off the Parasects around these parts. Shall we hunt say.. 8, then move onto the next task?
Quests.End Dialogue: What a good warmup. Next, I think we'll take on the Vampire roaming around the old power plant. Ensis repair crews have been too scared to venture that deep into the facility. Take it on, and I'll teach you how to butcher!

Quests.Name: Vampire Hunter
Quests.Description: There's a vampire in the Power Plant. Saira needs help taking it down.
Quests.End Dialogue: Great! Let's move onto something tougher. There's a big beastie I like to call <color=yellow>"Noggins"</color> roaming around these parts. I call it that because well... It has two heads.

Quests.Name: Noggins Be Gone
Quests.Description: Hunt the roaming creature, "Noggins".
Quests.End Dialogue: Whew, what a tough one! Thanks for your help. I've had this rifle for a few years now, and it's served me admirably. I'd like you to have it, as a thank you gift. Come back later, and we will do some more hunting together!

Quests.Name: Xzol's Champion
Quests.Description: Pleicol wants you to take down a <color=yelow>Ranger of Xzol</color>.
Quests.Start Dialogue: Hello, my name is Pleicol. I'm the lead scholar of this facility. We've been looking into the <color=yellow>Kin of the Deep</color> recently, especially the strange anomalies seemingly protecting them. The Kindred call them "gods", but I'm not so sure. They pick special individuals to be their champions. In fact, I've been tracking one for a little while now. Maybe you'd like to take it out for me? Be careful, this being is extremely strong. It is proficient with firearms, so try not to get into a ranged battle with it.
Quests.End Dialogue: How did you fare? Interesting creature, eh? My thanks for performing that task. Hopefully this makes it worth your while. I've been told you've taken down a Deep Hunter. Would you like to try your luck against something even more interesting? Virash Saints are noble warriors devoted to the "gods" of the planet. I'd like you to take one down for me.

Quests.Name: Impending Martyr
Quests.Description: Pleicol wants you to take down a <color=yelow>Virash Saint</color>.
Quests.End Dialogue: Another one down. You're quite good at this. I have one more mark for you, a Demigod. Now, the name isn't exactly accurate. These guys are quite like the Deep Hunters you'll find roaming caves, only stronger. Take it down, and show the Kin that men will rise above gods.

Quests.Name: All Demi, No God
Quests.Description: Pleicol wants you to take down the improperly-named <color=yellow>Demigod</color>.
Quests.End Dialogue: Well done! Here's some money for your troubles.

Quests.Name: Isazna, the Prophet
Quests.Description: Find the <color=orange>Kin of the Deep</color> prophet, <color=orange>Isazna</color>. She is located under the <color=yellow>Ensis Stronghold</color>, in a prison cell.
Quests.Start Dialogue: Greetings, Ensis Initiate. I have a feeling the ones you've been affiliating with have been leading you astray. The Kin of the Deep aren't exactly on their "nice" list. What if I told you there's a darker side to the Ensis? We have a prophet, captured by those you trust. I'm not asking for you to believe, only that you talk to her, listen to what she has to say. Find a way into the <color=yellow>Prison</color> and talk to <color=orange>Isazna</color>. The rest I leave up to fate.
Quests.End Dialogue:
You're not exactly one of them, are you? Greetings, my name is Isazna. Did Gemskhet send you? Good, then everything is occuring as expected. We, The Kin of the Deep, represent a new era for this planet.  Look where our ancestors lead us, to a prison billions of miles away.
I need you to do me a favor. Retrieve an artifact from the <color=yellow>Volcano</color> nearby, and I will show you marvelous things. There are forces at work that you cannot even comprehend. Take this suit. It will help you deal with the heat.

Quests.Name: Searching for Artifacts
Quests.Description: Isazna asked you to retrieve an artifact from the <color=yellow>Volcano</color>, then bring it back to her.
Quests.End Dialogue: My thanks, wanderer. This will surely help us. You are worthy of the Ancient Ones' attention. If you wish, you can be of more use to us. Do not be frightened, child. There is another artifact in the Ensis Stronghold Exterior Area. Just one level up, then slightly south. Take it, by any means. With the two artifacts, the Deep Ones will heed our call, and raise us to their breast. All others will serve the Kin. We need that artifact.

Quests.Name: The Second Artifact
Quests.Description: Grab the second artifact, located in the <color=yellow>Ensis Stronghold Exterior</color>, then return to <color=yellow>Isazna</color>.
Quests.End Dialogue: Well done, wanderer. I now have the means to grant the Deep Ones physical bodies. The next step is getting me out of here without too much of a fuss. There should be enough extra power in these artifacts for some invisibility. Please take me to the Hideout!

Quests.Name: Escape
Quests.Description: Take Isazna to the <color=yellow>Kindred Hideout</color>.
Quests.End Dialogue: Yet again you have my thanks. Talk to Gemskhet, my child. I think he has something for you to do.

Quests.Name: Stolen Blade
Quests.Description: Find the thief of Gemskhet's Ritual Dagger, kill him, and bring the blade back to its rightful owner.
Quests.Start Dialogue: You brought her back to us! You please us with your devotion. I have something more for you to do. A peasant has stolen something from me, my Ritual Dagger. Find the one responsible, and bring the dagger back to me. This is not Ensis work, so don't be surprised to find them unwilling to accept you with open arms after this. If you are one of us, prove it.
Quests.End Dialogue: You found it? Splendid. I hope it did not trouble you to spill a little blood in our name. One more thing... I need some intel on the Xul to the South. Could you check on them, and report back to me? Their pitiful village is in the Red Desert. Be wary of the wildlife and sandstorms.

Quests.Name: Meeting the Xul
Quests.Description: Gemskhet needs you to check on the Xul. You can find them in the Red Desert.
Quests.End Dialogue: No resistance from the south? Perfect. Thank you, (PLAYERNAME). We have the dagger, the artifacts, and now we need the ritual area. There's a place of power out in the water. A betrayer of the Ensis lives in solitude inside the city of Magna Dwyll. The man's name is <color=yellow>Oromir</color>, but he now calls himself "<color=yellow>The Duke of Lies</color>". Be wary, as this crafty fellow has amassed some kind of army. We hope to harness the source's power instead. Kill him, and return here.

Quests.Name: A Source of Power
Quests.Description: Go to the city <color=yellow>Magna Dwyll</color>, and kill <color=yellow>Oromir, the Duke of Lies</color>.
Quests.End Dialogue:
I trust the Duke of Lies has been slain? Good now we move onto the next phase of our plan...

<color=grey>(TO BE CONTINUED...)</color>

Quests.Name: Homonculus
Quests.Description: Faust needs 4 body parts to reconstruct an old colleague.
Quests.Start Dialogue: Need something to do? I'm trying to reconstruct an old colleague of mine, but lack the required body parts. I still have his head and torso, but must aquire four more limbs. No, I don't care what they are. I would prefer them to be somewhat organic, but you know what? Surprise me. It would be an interesting experiment in itself to form a unique body shape.
Quests.End Dialogue: All done? Splendid! I shall get to work right away. Take these for your troubles. I may have a need for your services again soon. I wish to experiment on these creatures' combat abilities. Maybe you'll be able to take one with you next time. If I'm feeling generous, that is.

Quests.Name: Creepy Crawlies
Quests.Description: Kill the Neant Queen in her nest beneath an abandoned shrine.
Quests.Start Dialogue: There's an abandoned Kin shrine out there, just waiting to be pillaged. The problem is the nest of Neants beneath it. If you kill the queen, I'd split the profit with you.
Quests.End Dialogue: You have my thanks! Here's something for your troubles.

Quests.Name: Long Pig
Quests.Description: The man known as "Kilovir" asked you, as a fellow cannibal, to gather some flesh for him to prepare for like-minded allies. 5 pieces would be perfect.
Quests.Start Dialogue: I've been watching you. You have a very... peculiar taste, don't you? Don't worry, I'm very much the same, and would like to make you a deal. I have a very nice weapon, perfect for segmenting flesh on humans. All you need to do is bring me some meat. How does that sound?
Quests.End Dialogue: Perfect. Here's the weapon as promised. I shall prepare a feast tonight!

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 1
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponent is <color=yellow>1 Bandit</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the first wave in the arena. Kill all hostile enemies.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 2
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponents are <color=yellow>2 Bandit Scouts</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the second wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 3
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponents are <color=yellow>2 Bandit Scouts</color> and <color=yellow>1 Bandit</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the third wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 4
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponents are <color=yellow>1 Bandit Scout</color> and <color=yellow>1 Bandit Brute</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the fourth wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 5
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponents are <color=yellow>2 Test Subjects</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the fifth wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 6
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponent is <color=yellow>1 Phlogistonist</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death.
Quests.Description: Defeat the sixth wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. Come back later for more fights.

Quests.Name: Arena Wave 7
Quests.Start Dialogue: Wanna step into the arena? Today's opponent is <color=yellow>1 Restless Nightmare</color>. Be wary. These fights are to the death. This is an extremely dangerous foe.
Quests.Description: Defeat the seventh wave in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show, here's your pay. I would like to do some daily fights. It'll take me some time to gather new creatures. Come back tomorrow to check them out!

Quests.Name: Daily Arena Challenge
Quests.Start Dialogue: Greetings, (PLAYERNAME). Care to step into the arena for my daily challenge? You never know what you might find in there.
Quests.Description: Kill the combatants in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another fight.

Quests.Name: Daily Arena Challenge
Quests.Start Dialogue: Greetings, (PLAYERNAME). Care to step into the arena for my daily challenge? You never know what you might find in there.
Quests.Description: Kill the combatants in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another fight.

Quests.Name: Daily Arena Challenge
Quests.Start Dialogue: Greetings, (PLAYERNAME). Care to step into the arena for my daily challenge? You never know what you might find in there.
Quests.Description: Kill the combatants in the arena.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another fight.

Quests.Name: Daily Hunt
Quests.Start Dialogue: Hunting time! Kill 4 Waste Walkers then come back to me! Interested?
Quests.Description: Hunt 4 Waste Walkers for Saira's Daily Hunt.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another hunt.

Quests.Name: Daily Hunt
Quests.Start Dialogue: Hunting time! Kill 6 Neants then come back to me! Interested?
Quests.Description: Hunt 6 Neants for Saira's Daily Hunt.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another hunt.

Quests.Name: Daily Hunt
Quests.Start Dialogue: Hunting time! Kill 5 Neants then come back to me! Interested?
Quests.Description: Hunt 5 Venomous Slimes for Saira's Daily Hunt.
Quests.End Dialogue: Good show. Come back tomorrow for another hunt.
